title: Mother of 4-year-old struck by bullet in Ann Arbor sentenced
content:
The mother of a 4-year-old boy accidentally struck by a bullet in May has received a suspended jail sentence in the incident.
The 33-year-old Ann Arbor woman pleaded no contest to charges of fourth degree child abuse and contributing to the delinquency of a minoron May 27, court records show.
She received a suspended sentence of a year in jail and six months of probation for the child abuse charge in Washtenaw County 15th District Court on June 10, court records indicate.
She also received a delayed sentence for contributing to the delinquency of a minor.
The woman was charged with the misdemeanors after a child playing with a gun at her Valencia Circle home discharged the weapon and her son's head was grazed by the bullet.
He was taken to University of Michigan C. S. Mott Children's Hospital in stable condition and released in the following days.
The child was home with three other children at the time of the incident and police have declined to comment on whether an adult was home at the time.
According to Michigan Penal Code, a person commits fourth degree child abuse if their omission or reckless act causes physical harm to a child or if they knowingly commit an act that poses risk or harm to a child.
Court records indicate Children's Protective Services continue to work with the family.
Darcie Moran covers cops and courts for MLive and The Ann Arbor News. Email her at dmoran@mlive.com or follow her on Twitter @darciegmoran.
